intro: Andromeda catesbaei, commonly known as the rosebay witch-hazel, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that turn red in the fall, and its fragrant, yellow flowers bloom in late winter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. The plant's unique blooming time makes it a valuable early-season pollinator resource.
